protocol.text: Arabidopsis thaliana (accession Col-0) and the cs26 mutant (SALK_034133) were grown in soil supplemented with Hoagland media. Plants were grown under a long-day photoperiod of 16 h of white light at 20degreeC/8 h in the dark at 18degreeC, or under a short-day photoperiod of 8 h of white light at 20degreeC/16 h in the dark at 18degreeC. The light intensity ranged from 140 to€“ 160 E m-2 s-1.

The leaves of 3-week-old plants grown under identical LD conditions, and the leaves of 5-week-old plants grown under identical SD conditions were collected and RNA extracted from each sample. Total RNA was isolated with Trizol reagent (Invitrogen) followed by cleaning with the RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen).
Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 4 µg total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).

Following fragmentation, 15 µg of biotinylated cRNA were hybridized to Affymetrix chips (GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array). Each sample was added to a hybridization solution containing 100mM 2-(N-morpholino)ethanesulfonic acid, 1 M Na+, and 20mM of EDT
GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G
GeneChip intensities were background-corrected, normalized and sumarized by RMA method, using the affylmGUI R� package from Bioconductor.
